data.title: My Awesome Trip to Singapore: The Sunny Island!

children.text: Hey guys! So, I just got back from this super cool trip to Singapore, and I have to tell you all about it. It was such a fun mix of learning, exploring, and, of course, eating!

Heres what went down: We started off with an opening ceremony at NTU (Nanyang Technological University), and let me tell you, this place is HUGE. Like, seriously massive. We got to explore the campus, and the best part was taking pics with the Hive Building. Its this super iconic building that looks like a beehive (duh, right?). But get thisour student guide told us there are 56 classrooms inside! How crazy is that? I couldnt even imagine having classes in such a cool-looking building.

After the tour, we went for lunch at Song Fa Bak Kut Teh, which is apparently super famous. It was my first time trying it, and it was interesting. The dough fritters were really good with the soup, but the soup itself was way too peppery for me. Still, it was fun to try something new! Oh, and throughout the trip, we got to try Malay food too. It was so flavorful and different from what Im used to. Im definitely a fan now!

The AI courses at NTU were actually pretty cool. We had these discussions and exchanges about artificial intelligence, and it was mind-blowing to hear how its being used in the real world. The best part? At the end of the session, we got to create our own model! It was so satisfying to see something we learned about actually come to life.

Now, lets talk about the real funSentosa Island! I didnt even know this before, but Sentosa is actually its own little island. People used to only get there by cable car or car, but a few years ago, they built a walkway, so now its super easy to get to. And oh my gosh, the rollercoasters! I screamed my lungs out, but it was SO MUCH FUN. If you ever go to Sentosa, you have to try them. Trust me, its worth it.

This trip was honestly one of the best experiences ever. I got to explore a huge university, try new foods, learn about AI, and have a blast at Sentosa. Singapore is such a cool placesunny, vibrant, and full of surprises. If you ever get the chance to go, dont think twice. Just do it!

data.title: My Summer Camp Experience at Epsom College: 16 Days of Language, Culture, and Fun

children.text: This summer, I had the incredible opportunity to attend a 16-day global camp at Epsom College in the UK. It was a perfect blend of learning, adventure, and cultural exploration. During the day, we had ESL classes, which were both challenging and fun. The teachers were amazingfriendly, patient, and always encouraging us to raise our hands and share our ideas.

I felt my confidence in speaking English grow every day! After classes, we enjoyed a mix of indoor games and outdoor activities. The outdoor activities were my favorite because we got to play different sports as a team. Basketball was definitely the highlight! The evenings were just as exciting. On the first night, we had a movie night, and they screened Mission: Impossible. It was so much fun watching it with my new friends from all over the world. We laughed, cheered, and bonded over the action-packed scenes.

One of the best parts of the camp was the excursion trips. We visited museums where I saw fascinating artifacts from ancient Egypt, Rome, and China. I took so many picturesit felt like I was traveling through time! The most inspiring trip was to Oxford University. Walking through the historic campus, surrounded by academics and students, was a dream come true.

This experience motivated me to work harder and aim higher. After the excursions, we returned to Epsom College for more lessons. We dove into logical thinking and cultural lessons, which were eye-opening. I learned so much about different cultures and perspectives, and it made me appreciate the diversity of our world even more. The food in the UK was...meh at the start! It was different from what Im used to, but I quickly found my favorites. Pasta and bread with butter became my go-to meals. I even tried some traditional British dishes, which were interesting, to say the least!

Looking back, this summer camp was more than just a language programit was a journey of growth, friendship, and discovery. I improved my English, made lifelong friends, and gained a deeper understanding of the world.

data.title: My Unforgettable Language Exchange Program at Ritsumeikan University

children.text: Last year, I participated in a two-week language exchange program at Ritsumeikan University in Japan. The program was structured with morning classes from 9 AM to 12 PM. The teachers at Ritsumeikan University were incredibly patient and supportive. Even though I struggled with pronouncing Japanese words at times, they were always encouraging and made the learning process enjoyable. Their dedication helped me gain confidence in speaking Japanese, and Im so grateful for their guidance. I miss them so much!

One of the highlights of the program was the cultural activities. Each week, we had two cultural experiences on weekdays, and they were absolutely fascinating. The first activity was watching a Maiko and Geiko performance. I was completely amazed by their grace and skill. What shocked me the most was learning about the years of rigorous training they undergo. During their training, they arent allowed to use phones or go home, and their traditional clothing is incredibly intricate and special.

The second activity was Japanese drumming (Taiko). We got to try beating the drums ourselves, and it was such a fun and energetic experience. After morning classes, I would have lunch with my classmates at the school canteen. The meals were not only affordable but also delicious! My absolute favorite was chirashi dona bowl of sushi rice topped with fresh sashimi and a perfectly cooked onsen egg on the side.

With weekends off, I had the chance to explore Kyoto, a city rich in history and culture. From visiting stunning temples like Kinkaku-ji to strolling through the iconic Arashiyama Bamboo Grove, every moment felt like a new adventure. Kyotos blend of tradition and modernity left me in awe, and Im so glad I got to experience it.

Looking back, this language exchange program was more than just learning Japaneseit was a journey of personal growth, cultural understanding, and making lifelong memories. I improved my language skills, immersed myself in Japanese traditions, and met amazing people from all over the world. Until next time, !

data.title: US Language Camp: Learning, Friends, and Fun!

children.text: I had an amazing time at the camp! The camp canteen served buffet-style meals, so I could try everythingpasta, salads, burgers, and desserts! It was a delicious way to experience American food.

We also went on exciting trips, like visiting MIT and its museum, where I saw futuristic technology that blew my mind. Another trip was to Plymouth, where we learned about American history. It was so interesting!

In the next few days, I attended a seminar called "How to Choose the Right School," which helped me think about my future. I also got tips for the TOEFL and SAT exams, which will help me stand out when applying to schools. The teachers were super supportive, and I feel much more confident speaking English now.

Evenings were the best part! We had karaoke nights where we sang our favorite songs, disco parties where we danced nonstop, and movie nights where we watched films together. My favorite was the Hawaiian dance party. There was also a cultural showcase, where we shared traditions from our countries. It was so cool to learn about different cultures.

This camp taught me so much more than English. I learned how to write a strong resume and essay for college applications. I even got to talk to university admissions counselors, who gave me great advice. But the best part was making friends from all over the world. We've already promised to stay in touch! This camp was one of the best experiences of my life.

data.title: My First Overseas Adventure: A STEM Program in Japan

children.text: When I first found out I was going to Japan for a STEM program, I was so excited but also really nervous. It was my first time traveling overseas, and I didn't know what to expect. My parents were worried, too. They kept asking me if I was ready and would be okay without them.

But after spending a week in Japan, I can honestly say it was one of the best experiences of my life, and my parents aren't worried anymore! The program was amazing. We did so many cool things, like visiting high-tech labs and learning about robotics. I even got to build my own mini robot! Japan's technology is so advancedit felt like stepping into the future.

One of the highlights was visiting a science museum where we saw robots that could play sports and even have conversations. It was mind-blowing! I also loved how the program mixed learning with fun. We had workshops where we worked in teams to solve problems, and it was awesome to see how everyone's ideas came together.

I made so many new friends from different countries, and we all bonded over our love for science and technology. It was cool to see how STEM brings people together, no matter where they're from. Of course, there were some challenges too. At first, I was a little homesick, and the language barrier made things tricky sometimes. But the program leaders were so supportive, and they made sure we felt safe and comfortable.

By the end of the week, I felt like I could navigate the city and even order food in Japanese! It was such a proud moment when I successfully asked for ramen at a restaurant. One of the best parts of the trip was proving to myselfand my parentsthat I could handle being on my own. I learned how to manage my time, take care of my things, and adapt to new situations.

My parents were so proud when I told them about everything I did, and they said they were not worried about me traveling alone anymore. Japan was an incredible place, and the STEM program made it even more special. I'll never forget the friends I made, the things I learned, and the adventures I had.

data.title: 2025 Japan Tokyo Anime Culture Exploration Summer Program

children.text: The 2025 Japan Tokyo Anime Culture Exploration Summer Program is a 7-day immersive experience designed for students aged 7 and above (with optional parental participation). This program offers a unique opportunity to dive deep into Japan's vibrant anime culture, visit iconic manga museums, interact face-to-face with professional manga artists, and explore top universities like the University of Tokyo and Waseda University. Participants will also enjoy excursions to Tokyo Disneyland and Mount Fuji, creating unforgettable memories while gaining insights into Japan's rich cultural heritage and technological traditions.
Explore Japan's anime history and industry through visits to Suginami Animation Museum and Fujiko F. Fujio Museum (Doraemon Museum).
Learn to create your own manga and animation under the guidance of professional manga artists.
Tour prestigious institutions like the University of Tokyo and Waseda University to understand Japan's academic excellence.
Experience Japan's natural beauty at Mount Fuji and cutting-edge technology at the Miraikan (National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation).
Spend a day at Tokyo Disneyland, enjoying its magical attractions and learning financial literacy through fun activities.

A world-renowned research university and one of the most prestigious comprehensive universities globally. - Known as Japan's highest academic institution and the first of the original Imperial Universities. - History: Founded in 1877 as Japan's first national comprehensive university and one of Asia's earliest Western-style universities. - Ranking: Ranked 13th globally and 1st in Japan in the 2016 CWUR World University Rankings. - Achievements: Alumni include Nobel Prize winners, Fields Medalists, Japanese prime ministers, and Speakers of the House of Representatives. - Global Influence: Unmatched influence in Japan and worldwide.

With small class sizes and expert guidance, this program ensures a safe, enriching, and unforgettable journey for young learners.

Courses and workshops at top Singaporean institutions like Nanyang Technological University and the Science Centre Singapore.

Participate in environmental demonstrations and STEM courses with practical applications.
Engage in group work and team-building exercises to foster collaboration and friendship.
Learn from experienced educators and industry professionals to gain insights into the future of STEM and AI.

We warmly invite outstanding high school students passionate about artificial intelligence to join us in exploring the mysteries of AI and its impact on the future of society. From January 20 to January 24, 2025, participants will engage in a 5-day AI Exploration Program at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore. By learning cutting-edge AI technologies such as ChatGPT, students will gain a global perspective and insights into the latest advancements in the field. This program offers a unique opportunity to experience life at a world-leading university while developing critical skills for the future.

The "Path to Ivy League" Summer Program at CATS Academy Boston is a 15-day immersive experience designed for students aged 14 to 18 who are aiming to prepare for top-tier universities, particularly Ivy League institutions. Located in the academic hub of Boston, this program offers a unique blend of rigorous academic preparation, cultural exploration, and personal growth. Participants will engage in TOEFL and SAT training, attend university application workshops, and visit prestigious institutions like Harvard and MIT, all while experiencing life at a top American boarding school.
Intensive TOEFL and SAT training, along with personalized college application guidance.
Stay and study at CATS Academy Boston, a leading international boarding school with a proven track record of sending students to Ivy League universities.
Visit Harvard University, MIT, and other top institutions to gain insights into campus life and academic excellence.
Participate in themed parties, city explorations, and team-building activities to foster cross-cultural friendships.
Learn from experienced teachers and university admissions counselors who provide hands-on support for college applications.

data.title: N Cambridge International Academic Summer School 14 days

children.text: The Cambridge International Academic Summer School is a 14-day immersive    educational experience designed for students aged 12 and above. Hosted at two of  Cambridge University's most prestigious colleges, Peterhouse and Jesus College, the program offers a unique blend of academic rigor, cultural exploration, and
personal growth. Students will engage in small-class learning, explore a wide range of academic disciplines, and participate in extracurricular activities that foster
Small Class Sizes: Each class consists of approximately 8 students, ensuring personalized attention.
Diverse Academic Offerings: Over 20 academic courses are available, ranging from Aerospace Engineering and AI to Creative
Global Student Body: 90% of participants are international students, fostering a multicultural learning environment.
Accommodation: Students stay in Cambridge University student  dormitories, experiencing life as a Cambridge student.
Expert Faculty: Courses are taught by instructors from top global universities, including Cambridge and Oxford.
Personalized Reports: Students receive a teacher-signed, personalized report that can be used for future academic applications.
International University Fair: Students have the opportunity to interact  directly with admissions officers from global universities.
Safety and Support: A 1:6 staff-to-student ratio ensures a safe and supportive environment.

The 14-day program is structured to balance academic learning, cultural exploration, and recreational activities. Below is a sample itinerary:
Day    Morning                       Afternoon                                             Evening
D1      Arrival at the University of Cambridge     Welcome to CambridgeIcebreaker
D2      Student Welcome Ceremony / Elective Courses           Cambridge Mission @  Chapel Court / Guided Oxford City Tour      (Geoff Howe: Sharing from a Cambridge Porter)          -
D3      Elective Courses      Kings College Tour / Fitzwilliam Museum / Football Match / Tote Bag Painting               Movie Night
D4      Movie Night   Elective Courses / Board Games + Just Dance Ghost Tour / Art History Lecture
D5      Day Trip to London  Day Trip to London  Day Trip to London
D6      Elective Courses      Elective Courses / Special Lecture           Bowling / British
D7      Elective Courses      Tennis Match / Mysterious Cambridge Tour       Watching
Shakespeare in Love / Watching Hamlet at Kings College
D8      Elective Courses      Punting on the River Cam / Hockey Match         Spelling
D9      Elective Courses      Elective Courses / Free Time        Lecture: University
D10    Elective Courses      International Education FairDirect Interaction with
Admissions Officers / Yoga Class Cambridge University Student Panel Discussion D11    Elective Courses      Elective Courses / Free Time        Expert Lecture
D12    Elective Courses      Talent Show  Karaoke / British Sports Activities
D13    Final Assessment for Elective Courses    Free Time / Graduation Ceremony
1.  Academic Excellence: Courses are taught by renowned faculty, including Dr. Chinedu Nwaduru(Oxford), Dr. Kritika Jerath (Cambridge), and Dr. Kristian  Saull (Cambridge).
2.  Cultural Immersion: Students participate in activities like Shakespearean  theater performances, punting on the River Cam, and guided museum  tours.
3.  Extracurricular Activities: From sports tournaments to creative
workshops, students engage in a variety of activities that enhance their social and leadership skills.
4.  University Exposure: The program includes visits to Cambridges historic
colleges, lectures by Cambridge scholars, and an international university fair.
5.  Personal Growth: Students develop independence, cross-cultural
communication skills, and a deeper understanding of their academic interests.
Accommodation: Students stay in Cambridge University
dormitories (single or double rooms) at either Peterhouse or Jesus College.
Meals: Breakfast and dinner are provided in the college dining halls, offering a variety of nutritious options. Lunch is self-catered, allowing students to explore local restaurants and cafes.
24/7 Supervision: Experienced staff provide round-the-clock support.
Health and Safety: The program includes fire drills, 24-hour security, and emergency protocols.
Travel Insurance: Comprehensive travel insurance is included.
Included: Tuition, accommodation, meals (breakfast and dinner), activities, and travel insurance.
Not Included: International airfare, visa fees, personal expenses, and optional activities.

children.text: Adcote School Malaysia is the fourth overseas branch of the prestigious British institution Adcote School (UK), established after the China campus. It has won the Best British Independent School Award in 2020 and 2021, and ranked 83rd among nearly 3000 UK secondary schools in 2023. In just five years, 13 graduates from Adcote's global campuses have been admitted to Oxford and Cambridge Universities. The school integrates Eastern and Western educational philosophies, fostering students with a global perspective, innovation, independence, leadership, and social responsibility through a holistic approach.

Located 40 minutes from KL International Airport, Adcote School Malaysia offers a premium campus with global standards, safe environment, cost-effective fees, and a focus on innovation, independence, and leadership. Highlights include:
Geographical Location: Situated in the Kuala Lumpur Metropolitan Area, only 40 minutes from KL International Airport.
Premium Campus: Built to international standards, managed by Chinese shareholders, providing on-campus apartments.
Safe Environment: Reasonable fees, high cost-effectiveness.

Adcote School Malaysia provides education from kindergarten to senior high school, with specialized programs like IGCSE, A-Level, ESL enhancement, and a wide range of extracurricular activities to ensure holistic development. The academic program includes:
Academic Stages: Kindergarten, Primary, Junior High, Senior High (IGCSE & A-Level).
Specialized Programs: ESL English Enhancement, CCA Extracurricular Activities.
Extracurricular Activities: Golf, rock climbing, swimming, karting, karate, ball sports, languages, mathematics, cooking, crafts, etc.
Swimming pool, tennis courts, squash courts, bowling alley, SPA, libraries, laboratories, gym, sports centers, student apartments, and medical support. Campus facilities include:
Main Entrance (South): Swimming pool, tennis courts, squash courts, bowling alley, SPA, dining hall.
Teaching Block, Library, Laboratories, Dining Hall, Gym: Golf course, dining center.
Outdoor Sports Field (Track, Football, Rugby): Extreme sports center (rock climbing, water sports, skateboarding, archery, racing).
Indoor Sports Hall (Rock Climbing, Badminton, Basketball, Football): Residential area (long-term rental for parents).
Student Apartments, Medical Center, Apartment Facilities: 400 meters from petrol station and commercial area.
Man-Made Lake: Planned for kayaking; equestrian facilities are under planning, with an existing equestrian center.
Admission involves an application fee, interviews, and assessments (e.g., CAT4, OPT). The admission process includes:
Admission Requirements: Online/in-person interview and assessment (CAT4, OPT, etc., depending on grade level).
